title: Generate QR code with all customization options
description: Verify that a user can create a QR code applying colors, dot styles, corner styles, logos, and watermarks, and the generated QR code reflects all these customizations.

steps.description: Open the QR code generator page.
Select custom colors for foreground and background.
Choose a dot style and corner style.
Upload a logo and enable watermark toggle.
Generate the QR code.
Verify the QR code displays with the selected colors, dot and corner styles.
Verify the uploaded logo is correctly embedded.
Verify watermark is visible and does not obstruct QR code scans.

title: User registration with valid data
description: Test that a new user can successfully register using valid information and receive confirmation.

steps.description: Navigate to the sign-up page.
Input valid username, email, and strong password.
Submit the registration form.
Confirm registration success message is shown.
Confirm that user is redirected to login or dashboard as appropriate.

title: User login with correct credentials
description: Ensure users can log in with valid credentials and maintain session persistence.

steps.description: Go to the login page.
Enter valid email and password.
Click the login button.
User is successfully logged in and redirected to the dashboard.
User session persists across browser reloads.

title: User login with invalid credentials
description: Verify application behavior when a user attempts login with incorrect email or password.

steps.description: Navigate to the login page.
Input invalid email or password.
Click the login button.
Verify that login fails and appropriate error message is displayed.
Confirm user is not redirected and remains on login page.

title: Save generated QR code to authenticated user's dashboard
description: Test that after login, a user can save a generated QR code to their dashboard and it appears in the saved codes list.

steps.description: Log in with valid user credentials.
Generate a QR code with custom options.
Save the QR code to user's account.
Navigate to dashboard.
Verify the saved QR code appears in the user's list.
Verify saved code metadata such as creation date and customization options are visible.

title: Dynamic QR code expiration enforcement
description: Confirm that dynamic QR codes expire and become invalid after the specified expiration time.

steps.description: Create or update a dynamic QR code setting an expiration date/time shortly in the future.
Access the QR code before expiration and verify scanning redirects correctly.
Simulate or wait until after the expiration time.
Attempt to scan/visit the QR code.
Verify that access is denied or redirected to an expiration notice.

title: Dynamic QR code scan limit enforcement
description: Check that scanning a dynamic QR code respects the defined scan limits and disables scanning beyond the limit.

steps.description: Create a dynamic QR code with a specific scan limit.
Scan the QR code repeatedly up to the scan limit.
Verify all scans up to the limit redirect correctly and analytics are updated.
Attempt to scan beyond the scan limit.
Verify scanning is blocked or redirected appropriately after exceeding the limit.

title: Download QR code in PNG and SVG formats
description: Verify that generated QR codes can be downloaded in both PNG and SVG formats accurately reflecting the design.

steps.description: Generate a QR code with custom design.
Download the QR code as PNG.
Confirm that the PNG file downloads correctly and the design matches the preview.
Download the QR code as SVG.
Confirm that the SVG file downloads correctly and the design matches the preview.

title: API: Create QR code with valid data
description: Test the QR Code RESTful API successfully creates a QR code resource when receiving valid data.

steps.description: Send a POST request to the QR code creation API endpoint with a valid payload including customization options.
Verify the API returns a success status and the created QR code data including unique identifier.

title: API: Update existing QR code
description: Verify that updating a QR code via the API applies changes correctly and returns updated data.

steps.description: Send a PUT request to the specific QR code API endpoint with modification data.
Confirm the API responds with success and the QR code record reflects the updated fields.

title: API: Delete QR code
description: Ensure the API deletes a QR code resource and subsequent fetch requests return not found.

steps.description: Send a DELETE request to the specific QR code API endpoint.
Verify the API responds with success status.
Send a GET request to retrieve the deleted QR code.
Confirm the API returns a not found or error status.

title: API: Bulk operations on QR codes
description: Test bulk creation, update, and deletion of QR codes through the API with proper response handling.

steps.description: Send a bulk POST request with multiple QR code data entries.
Confirm all QR codes are created and API returns list of created records.
Send a bulk update request with changes to multiple QR codes.
Verify all QR codes update correctly and API confirms the changes.
Send a bulk delete request for multiple QR code IDs.
Verify the QR codes are deleted successfully and responses confirm deletion.

title: Dashboard shows accurate analytics for QR codes
description: Validate that the user dashboard displays correct scan and download statistics for each QR code managed by the user.

steps.description: Log in and navigate to the user dashboard.
Select multiple saved QR codes.
Confirm the displayed analytics data matches the backend scan/download records accurately.

title: QR code scanning updates analytics correctly
description: When a QR code is scanned, verify that analytics in the database update correctly and the user is redirected as intended.

steps.description: Scan a valid QR code URL with an enabled analytics tracking.
Check that the scan is recorded in the analytics database.
Verify the user gets redirected to the correct target URL.

title: URL shortening and custom domain support
description: Validate the functionality of the URL shortener service including assigning custom domains linked to QR codes.

steps.description: Create a short URL for a QR code target.
Confirm the shortened URL redirects correctly.
Assign a custom domain to a QR code.
Verify that scanning the QR code uses the custom domain and redirects accordingly.

title: Watermark toggle functionality
description: Ensure that toggling watermark on and off correctly changes the QR code appearance and maintains scan reliability.

steps.description: Generate a QR code with watermark enabled.
Verify watermark is displayed on the QR code.
Toggle watermark off.
Confirm the QR code no longer displays the watermark.
Test scanning the QR code with and without watermark.
Verify QR code remains scannable in both states.

title: Dark/light theme toggle
description: Confirm the UI theme toggle successfully switches between dark and light modes without UI glitches or content loss.

steps.description: Navigate to any application page.
Toggle the theme switch to dark mode.
Verify the UI changes to dark theme visually.
Toggle the theme switch back to light mode.
Verify the UI returns to light theme without content missing.

title: Route protection and API endpoint security
description: Verify that protected routes and API endpoints enforce authentication and deny access to unauthorized users.

steps.description: Attempt to access the user dashboard URL without logging in.
Check that access is denied or redirected to the login page.
Send a request to a protected API endpoint without credentials.
Confirm the request is rejected with an unauthorized error.

title: Responsive UI and mobile friendliness
description: Ensure the application interface including navigation, dashboard, and QR code pages render and function correctly across a range of screen sizes and devices.

steps.description: Open the application on desktop resolution.
Verify UI elements are properly aligned and functional.
Resize window to tablet and mobile screen sizes.
Check that UI adapts according to the screen size with no overflow or usability issues.

title: Error boundary handling and user feedback
description: Test that uncaught errors in components or pages result in graceful error messages and do not break the application flow.

steps.description: Simulate an error in a major component such as QR code generation or dashboard rendering.
Verify that a user-friendly error boundary message is displayed.
Confirm user can navigate away or retry without application crash.

title: Anonymous user basic QR code generation and download
description: Validate that users without authentication can create simple QR codes with basic customization and download them as PNG or SVG.

steps.description: Open the homepage as an anonymous user.
Generate a simple QR code with basic color and data inputs.
Download the generated QR code as PNG.
Verify the download initializes and file opens with correct QR code.
Download the generated QR code as SVG.
Verify the SVG file downloads and displays as expected.

title: Logo upload validation and error handling
description: Ensure that invalid file types or large logo uploads are handled gracefully with appropriate error messages.

steps.description: Attempt to upload an unsupported file type as logo (e.g., .exe or .txt).
Verify an error message is shown and upload is rejected.
Attempt to upload a logo image exceeding size limits.
Confirm an error message appears indicating file size is too large.

title: QR code rendering across multiple devices and browsers
description: Verify QR codes render correctly and remain scannable across various devices (desktop, mobile) and browsers (Chrome, Firefox, Safari).

steps.description: Generate a QR code with distinct customizations.
Open the generated QR code page on multiple browsers and device types.
Ensure the QR code shows correctly and is scannable on each platform.

title: API: Export QR codes in bulk
description: Test that users can export multiple QR codes data through the API and receive formatted, complete data sets.

steps.description: Send a request to the bulk export API endpoint with valid authentication.
Verify response contains a complete export of selected QR codes.
Confirm exported data matches the latest QR code configurations.

title: Navigation adapts to user authentication state
description: Verify that navigation UI components show correct options and links depending on whether the user is authenticated or anonymous.

steps.description: Access the application without login.
Confirm navigation shows options relevant to anonymous users (e.g., sign in, sign up).
Log in with a valid user.
Verify navigation reflects authenticated options (e.g., dashboard, logout).
